oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John M. Vance, discharge from 1st Tennessee Mounted Infantry
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- Army -- Tennessee Mounted Infantry Regiment, 1st. ; Vance, John Moody, 1844-1900; United States History -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military discharges; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document detailing discharge of John M. Vance, Private, of Captain William J. Cleveland's Company A, 1st Regiment of Tennessee Mounted Infantry. Vance was discharged at Carthage, Tennessee, at the expiration of his term of service.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept -- Adjutant-Genereal's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vance's term of enlistment was one year; many other soldiers were called to serve three years. Once both the U. S. Government and the Confederacy began to use the draft to build their armies, the terms of service varied widely. Furthermore, a draftee could buy his way out of the army, or pay someone else to serve in his place.
